CSSBorder-collapse.summary: The border-collapse CSS property sets whether cells inside a table have shared or separate borders.

remarks.para: When cells are collapsed, the border-style value of inset behaves like ridge, and outset behaves like groove.
When cells are separated, the distance between cells is defined by the border-spacing property.

-border-spacing, border-style
-The border-collapse property alters the appearance of the table HTML element.
